item.title: GP Batteries has created a unique powerbank for the SEA Games
item.description: Source: GP Batteries. As the official battery partner for the SEA Games, GP Batteries has launched a limited-edition lithium-ion power bank to commemorate the upcoming games. This special power bank features a printed design of the 28th SEA Games Nila Logo and is officially recognized as an “Official Battery Partner” product. This power bank boasts a 10,400mAH capacity, making it perfect for charging smartphones and tablets. With two output ports, users can charge two devices concurrently while LED indicators display the remaining battery life.

item.title: Every Home And Business Is A Battery
item.description: This week’s blog posts are dedicated to Blog Action Day 2009’s theme: global warming, climate change, and alternative energy. We already established that alternative energy is a viable option, as solar and wind power are readily available. However, skeptics often question how to ensure a consistent energy supply when natural resources like sunlight and wind are inconsistent. This is a valid concern since traditional power plants fueled by coal, nuclear, or natural gas have built-in energy storage within their fuel sources and steam boilers.
